Key Match Events: Nikola Jokic recorded a triple-double with 35 points, 15 rebounds, and 12 assists
Jamal Murray had his best game of the season with 28 points on 9-of-17 shooting, plus four boards and six assists
Michael Porter Jr. and Christian Braun each had 21 points
Peyton Watson had 16 points on 7-of-11 shooting
Tyler Herro led the Heat with 24 points and 11 assists
Bam Adebayo had 10 points and nine rebounds
Duncan Robinson tallied 20 points on 6-of-10 shooting from distance
Jimmy Butler sprained his right ankle in the first quarter and did not return
Denver stormed out the gates offensively and didn't look back, shooting 61.7% from the floor and 51.4% from 3-point range
Miami struggled early but finished shooting 48.9% from the floor and 46.5% from 3-point range
The Nuggets beat the Heat in nine straight regular-season meetings, dating back to the 2020-21 season
Miami lost its third straight game and dropped to 3-5 on the season and 0-3 against the Western Conference
Pre-Game Insights: Jimmy Butler sprained his right ankle in the first quarter and did not return
Haywood Highsmith, Josh Richardson and Pelle Larsson got ample run during Butler's absence
Post-Match Reflections: LeBron James expressed pride in his team's effort after the comeback win
The coach highlighted the victory as a crucial step toward the championship
